ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: A fast-paced course where you will learn a lot about Jin ping mei; definitely recommend.
I would highly recommend Chinese 828 to any graduate level student who is interested in Chinese literature. It is a seminar dedicated to the close reading and analysis of the novel Jin Ping Mei.

This is a literature course rather than a Chinese language course. I would highly recommend it to anyone interested in late Ming fiction, print culture or vernacular novels in general. The class discusses the content of the novel as well as its historical context. It is not so much for students trying to learn Chinese.
I would recommend this course to others.It's a wonderful experience in literature and culture.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: my dissertation will be on late Ming-early Qing fiction, so it was right up my alley, and I learned a lot.
I gained much deeper knowledge in one of the most important novels in the history of Chinese literature, and learned new perspectives on late Ming social life and culture.
